name: Quality Inn Boardwalk

reviews.text: My family and I have been staying at the Quality Inn Boardwalk for a number of years now. We have gone to other places from time to time, but always came back. The oceanfront efficiency rooms are great, plenty of room, always clean, as is the bathroom. The ocean views are breathtaking. Watching dolphins frolic from your room balcony in the morning is a wonderful way to start your day. As for price, I think the rooms are reasonable for a property on the ocean. The Jersey shore and other places are much more expensive during the high season, as are the Rehoboth hotels. And the oceanfront rooms are tiny. The only negative for us has been the restaurant. Very slow service every time we have been there, though the food is okay. I plan to stay here next summer as well.
reviews.title: Don't Believe the Haters

reviews.text: NASTY!!!!.....DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Yes, many of the hotels in OC are older, but many have done updates to stay with the times. The photos on the website are so misleading. First off, our door barley closed which made us feel so safe..(NOT) and of course we had to have a drunk man banging on the door at 2am trying to get in swearing it was his room....great, we have a strong drunk man slamming into the door that is barley closed to begin with!! Then we walked into the room and noticed how old everything was, the couch and chair were falling apart, the two beds didnt even have bedskirts on them, exposing the nasty dirty ripped up boxsprings. When I complained to the front desk, I was told that "not all rooms come with bedskirts". Notice that the website does not have photos of the bathroom...thats becasue they are smatter than that. The bathroom has blue tiles from the 1970's and is falling apart. Our stay was middle sept. and a cold front came through. We couldnt get the heat to work so we once again called the front desk...only to be told that "heat wasnt available this time of year". I expressed my anger as it was to drop into the 40's that evening and I was told that they could bring me extra blankets...REALLY!!! It's freezing and raining and I cant use the heat!! Indoor pool was not heated! Even the hot tub was just a little hot. Parking is limited to one spot, yet the room holds four people, so I'm sure I'm not the first to want a second spot, which of course I was told that I couldnt get yet it was bike week and there were motorcycles in every inch of the parking lot....on the sidewalks...under the car port which was only to be used for drop off and pick up, so obviously we couldnt even pull our car up to pick up otheres in our party during the rain storms. Toliet paper and tissues are cheap, thin and rough. Tv is from the 1990's and barley works. Good luck getting on the elevators, they work half the time. This was a $200 a nite room that looks like a $79.99 a nite room. BAD, BAD, BAD!!! you've been warned..DONT TO IT!!
reviews.title: False ad- total crap!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here the last 3 years and loved it! Yes, it is a bit outdated and i do have to agree it is expensive. However, it is clean which is very important to me and the staff is excellent. I have never had any problems and every year we ask for the same room and get it no problem. We did have to stay one time during off season on the 1st floor and yes it was noisy but, we just were as noisy and laughed it off. The convenience of the location of the hotel we also love. We walk or drive our bikes everywhere. We always had good food & good service at the Oceanview and great drinks at the outside bar. I highly recommand. We always have an oceanview room and it's wonderful!
reviews.title: our yearly trip

reviews.text: I was supposed to stay here for three nights with a convention. I stayed only one night and found another hotel. This hotel is very dated (as many of them here are) but it is right on the ocean and if you can get an upper floor room with an ocean view I'm sure it would be ok. I however was supposed to get exactly that and on check in was put on the ground floor "ocean view". The ocean was there but on the other side of the fenced in pool that blocked my view. The other problem with ground level here is the noise! Avoid this! I went back to the desk to inquire about a new room and was told there was nothing available but a side smoking room with no view. I took a look and this room was right out of the 60's , including the blue toilet and bath tub. And also no difference in price. I stayed the one night....with almost no sleep, and promptly found another hotel.
reviews.title: Old and expensive

reviews.text: The worst part was the total lack of help from the staff. They didn't want to help me at all and didn't even offer n apology for the mix up. I definitely would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Not Bad, Not Good

reviews.text: I can not even begin to tell everyone how well mannered and helpful the staff was during our stay. the restuarant and lounge were excellent as well. the rooms were well kept and the cleaning staff was top notch. the Quality Inn made our entire golf vacation trip a super and unforgettable time. we will definitely be coming back here for years to come. It is a great family, couples and group hotel t ostay at. right on the ocean and boardwalk clsoe to everything.
reviews.title: Awesome bang for your buck.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We look forward every year to our trip to OC in the fall. Staying at the Quality Inn on 17th street has become part of that tradition. They consistently have great room rates, spacious rooms and the rooms have always been clean; that's outstanding considering how many years we have been staying there. The Inn is located within perfect walking distance of downtown. The Ocean View Grill located in the Inn service great food and our specialty is the breakfast which we always look forward to before our walk down town. It's just a great place to stay
reviews.title: Our yearly fall motorcycle trip to OC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to OC to run in a fall race and found a great deal on a room at the Quality Inn. Had no idea what to expect. It was fantastic. Amazing oceanfront view and fantastic staff. Good size room and bathroom and nice living and full kitchen areas. Would highly recommend. Just sorry I didn't have time for pool/ hot tub!
reviews.title: We were so lucky!

reviews.text: The room was wonderful. We had an ocean view room and sure enjoyed it. The room was clean and the people that work there were very helpful. Will stay there again.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Clean spacious OCEANFRONT...stove, clean, comfortable beds...quiet even during BIKE WEEK...good staff...rooms thoroughly clean EARLY...looks drab from streetside balcony, but great once you go inside...LARGE bathroom!!!
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: I'll start off with my complaint --- the room was freezing --- around 60 degrees. I fiddled with the thermostat for a few minutes and then debated whether I wanted to request a different room. I had already settled in and didn't want the inconvenience of moving. But, finally, I decided I couldn't get a comfortable night's sleep and would have to move. I called downstairs to let them know that the heat wasn't working --- only the AC. They told me that the heat was switched off for the entire building but, I could have extra blankets or a space heater. I took both -- and, it was a good thing -- the space heater took eight hours to get the room up to 70 degrees.
reviews.title: No heat...

reviews.text: If not for this experience, the rating would be 3 stars - average. My room had outdoor access leading to an old room. It was actually kind of quaint how old it was. The bathroom had a blue sink and blue toilet. Everything was old in my room. It was clean. I had a full kitchen - microwave, full sized fridge, stove/oven & dishwasher. Two queen bed and a sofabed. In adequate lighting. I also had a balcony that overlooked the hotel next door, but, looking off to the right, I could see the beach and ocean.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coffee and tea were available 24 hours in the lobby as well as being available in the rooms. Newspapers included WSJ, USA Today & the Baltimore Sun. Coke machines were a bargain at 40 cents. Corridors were dark. Parking was free. There's an indoor pool and hot tub.
reviews.title: Not a bad place to stay!!!

reviews.text: The staff was helpful - front desk clerk efficient and maintenance guy that brought the space heater was friendly (maybe overworked with delivering space heaters to all the hotel's guests?).
reviews.title: Not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would suggest staying here when you can be sure that the HVAC is operating appropriately and location is important.
reviews.title: We Liked It!!!!

reviews.text: We've stayed here several times, primarily in the spring or fall. You cannot beat the location. The most important thing to keep in mind is that there are two distinct sections of this hotel. If you get a room in the newer section, all is good. If you end up with a room in the older section, you definitely will not be happy. Make sure you get a guaranteed room in the new section.
reviews.title: Hit or miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here both off-season and during the summer for many years. The location on the boardwalk is excellent, the entire facility is clean and well-kept, and the staff is amazing. Love the oceanfront balcony, the kitchen amenities, both of the oceanfront pools, and the fabulous indoor pool. We'll definitely be back.
reviews.title: Awesome place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend had a fabulous time we stayed on the 4th floor room 402. The hotel staff was wonderful. The room was clean. Fresh towels daily.Hot Tea and Coffee in the lobby. Soda machines and candy machines on the side lobby. Pool, Hot tub, exercise room. Everything looked great. Rates were great.
reviews.title: Our Stay January13th thur January 15th, 2012

reviews.text: Thanks to the wonderful staff there at Quality!!! We would stay again.
reviews.title: Great NYE

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk over NYE. The hotel rooms, corridors, pool, restaurant, and other areas were all immaculate and well maintained. The elevators were a little slow, but the hotel was sold out so that's to be expected.
reviews.title: Great value room on the ocean!

description: Located directly on the boardwalk, the Quality Inn offers incredible views at affordable rates. Family friendly, the hotel offers two outdoor pools, game room, exercise room, oceanfront restaurant, heated indoor pool and Ocean City’s largest hot tub. Most rooms feature a fully stocked kitchenette and a private balcony. Our newly remodeled two-story Penthouse can accommodate up to 18 guests. From your convenient location, you are just a walk away from restaurants, shopping, nightclubs and more.
